metadata.name: Dataset::LookupResults
metadata.description:
LookupResults is a special case Array with additional values. A LookupResults object is returned from Dataset#find_all and contains the entities as well as the Keys that were deferred from the results and the Entities that were missing in the dataset.

Please be cautious when treating the QueryResults as an Array. Many common Array methods will return a new Array instance.

examples.code:
entities = dataset.find_all key1, key2, key3
entities.size #=> 3
entities.deferred #=> []
entities.missing #=> []

examples.caption: Caution, many Array methods will return a new Array instance:
examples.code:
entities = dataset.find_all key1, key2, key3
entities.size #=> 3
entities.deferred #=> []
entities.missing #=> []
names = entities.map { |e| e["name"] }
names.size #=> 3
names.deferred #=> NoMethodError
names.missing #=> NoMethodError

metadata.name: deferred
metadata.description: Keys that were not looked up due to resource constraints.

metadata.name: deferred=
metadata.description: Keys that were not looked up due to resource constraints.

metadata.name: missing
metadata.description: Entities not found, with only the key populated.

metadata.name: missing=
metadata.description: Entities not found, with only the key populated.

metadata.name: initialize
metadata.description: Create a new LookupResults with an array of values.
